author: Shannon Leavitt
message:
Merge pull request #1771 from nathanmcnulty/patch-1

Update PRT lifetime to 90 days

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "340bb925d1fcec3e373068cb87199dd3ac86cae5",
  "filename": "docs/identity/devices/concept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md",
  "status": "modified",

  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/0cc5d836a63f7fc9f29fdc171f97190cd6fccc6a/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fconcept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/0cc5d836a63f7fc9f29fdc171f97190cd6fccc6a/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fconcept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fconcept-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md?ref=0cc5d836a63f7fc9f29fdc171f97190cd6fccc6a",
  "patch": "@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ Another difference between the two token families: Sign-in session tokens are re\n \n | Token Type | Issued by | Purpose  | Scoped to Resource | Lifetime | Revocable | Renewable |\n |------|------|------|------|------|------|------|\n-| Primary Refresh Token (PRT)| Entra ID | Request Access Tokens | No – Can request an access token for any resource | 14 days\\*| Yes | Yes|\n+| Primary Refresh Token (PRT)| Entra ID | Request Access Tokens | No – Can request an access token for any resource | 90 days\\*| Yes | Yes|\n | Refresh Token| Entra ID| Request Access Tokens | Yes | 90 days\\* | Yes | Yes |\n | Access Token | Entra ID | Access the resource | Yes | Variable 60-90 minutes| Yes, if CAE capable | No |\n | App auth cookie| Web app | Access the resource | Yes  | Determined by application| Depends on application | No |"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the commit:

The change modifies a documentation file concerning Microsoft Entra ID tokens. Specifically, it updates the lifetime of a Primary Refresh Token (PRT) from 14 days to 90 days. This adjustment clarifies the duration for which a PRT remains valid for requesting access tokens.
